image.altText: A mid-shot of Adam Tomison wearing a suit and tie walking outside in the Perth CBD, with another man in front of him.

props.synopsis: WA's Department of Justice lied about the controversial Unit 18 youth detention facility before it opened, telling parents it would be a safer alternative for young people, the former departmental head tells a coronial inquest. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Justice boss admits ‘blatant lies’ about youth jail in bombshell testimony

image.altText: Park with a playground featuring sandpit, seesaw and yellow slide surrounded by tall trees

props.synopsis: A man who tried to kidnap multiple children, including a two-year-old girl, over the course of a single day in 2022 is jailed.

title.children: Perth man jailed for attempting multiple child kidnappings on same day

image.altText: A drill rig working in the outback with red dirt.

props.synopsis: One of the world's biggest drilling companies has been fined $385,000 after a worker was seriously injured while reassembling a drill rig at a remote mineral exploration camp in Western Australia three years ago.

title.children: Drilling company fined $385k after rig worker's head crushed

image.altText: A ring of fire propelling a hot air balloon into the sky.

props.synopsis: The wait is over, as the 2024 Olympic Games officially open with a parade on the Seine River in Paris. Follow live.

title.children: Cauldron lit and launched into the air as Aussies shine in Olympics opening ceremony

image.altText: Nathaniel Train is shown as a young boy holding a tennis racquet, overlaid with news headlines of his deadly shootout.

props.synopsis: The news headline told of cold-blooded murder, but the face staring back at me was that of my childhood friend, writes Josh Robertson.

title.children: As kids, we had slumber parties. Nobody picked Nathaniel as a killer

image.altText: A black coloured tractor in the Antarctic snow with whispy clouds across the blue sky. A large halo surrounds the sun.

props.synopsis: The temperature above the east Antarctic coastline warmed by about 50 degrees Celsius in a week earlier in July. The event, called a Sudden Stratospheric Warming has the potential to impact Australia's weather through August and possibly well into spring.

title.children: Australia's weather could be impacted by temperature over Antarctica warming by 50C

image.altText: Clare O'Neil looks towards Anthony Albanese at a joint press conference in the Prime Minister's courtyard at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is working the phones with Labor's factional bosses to maintain his government's much-vaunted cohesion as the prime minister moves to refresh a ministry under pressure over immigration, housing and the cost of living.

title.children: Anthony Albanese keeping cabinet reshuffle 'close to his chest'

image.altText: a 32yo man with facial hair wearing a white shirt and backwards cap

props.synopsis: Zak Grieve spent his 20s incarcerated alongside some of the Northern Territory's worst criminals. Now on parole, his life as a convicted murderer is under the microscope.

title.children: After 12 years in prison for a murder he didn't commit, Zak Grieve says he's 'not really free'

image.altText: Two woman shake hands with a man with an American flag draped behind them

props.synopsis: In the last three weeks, one woman has emerged as the key driver of efforts to push the Democratic Party towards a historic decision. Here's how Nancy Pelosi helped put Kamala Harris on the ticket.

title.children: 'I'm more reptilian, cold blooded': How Nancy Pelosi wielded her enormous power to show Biden the door

image.altText: A selfie of woman with a fringe in a brown polka dot top

props.synopsis: Over time, women have shared stories of feeling dismissed and ignored by healthcare professionals. Now the results of a national survey hint at just how serious the problem is.

title.children: For a year Debra told doctors she had pain in her chest. Then she had a second heart attack

image.altText: An aerial shot of Huione Pay's headquarters in Phnom Penh.

props.synopsis: A huge online marketplace linked to Cambodia's ruling family is allegedly being used to sell equipment to and launder money for the online scam industry — with Australians among those in the crosshairs.

title.children: Cambodian online marketplace outed as one-stop shop for scammers' money laundering and 'detention equipment' needs

image.altText: a purple light illuminates a thick web of computer cables in a dark room

props.synopsis: There is a growing sense of unease about global stock markets, and particularly Wall Street, as investors rush to sell off the tech stocks that have recently pushed markets to record highs.

title.children: Wall Street wobbles on Artificial Intelligence concerns

image.altText: A man with black hair wears a white and blue collared shirt speaking to someone out of shot

props.synopsis: Staff and family members of the three leaders say they have been taken to an unknown location by police.

title.children: Bangladesh police accused of removing protest leaders from hospital

image.altText: Man wearing black t shirt and grey beanie places pork ribs into a metal bbq smoker in a home backyard

props.synopsis: There's been an "explosive" surge in Australia's smoked meats community, with barbecue community groups serving as inadvertent online men's sheds where meat, mateship and masculinity are all on the menu.

title.children: The unusually tender smoked meat communities that mean so much to men

image.altText: Hatsune Miku is singing into a microphone and holding a guitar.

props.synopsis: While doomsayers may see virtual performers like Hatsune Miku and Plave as a threat to the creative industries, some artists are using the technology to their advantage.

title.children: These pop stars are virtual. Can they save Australia's ailing music business?

image.altText: A composite image of eight book covers on a green background

props.synopsis: On the list are the latest novel from a Miles Franklin-winning author, a celebration of the nurses on the frontline of the AIDS crisis and a laugh-out-loud foray into lesbian pulp fiction.

title.children: A 'gruesome romp' and 'one of the funniest books of the year': July's best reads

image.altText: Bl;ack and white photo of a man and a woman sitting on a couch, the man's arm extended along the back of it.

props.synopsis: Betty Bunning, who painted under the name Elizabeth Blair Barber, was a prolific WA artist whose brilliance was largely overlooked at the time — and it's led to a search for answers about eight mystery portraits.

title.children: Art mystery at the heart of belated recognition for woman who married into the Bunnings hardware empire

image.altText: A huge sand dune sits against a light blue sky with a blue lake stretching to it in the foreground with green reeds at its edge

props.synopsis: A "possibly unparalleled" desert, an archipelago with oceans "virtually free" from human exploitation and resting places for royals of old are among sites given world heritage status.

title.children: Chinese desert and ancient Indian burial grounds added to UNESCO's World Heritage List

image.altText: The exterior of Esperance Courthouse, made from grey concrete bricks, with an blue and brown Indigenous artwork of dolphins.

props.synopsis: A non-teaching staff member at Esperance Senior High School is suspended over historical allegations of child sex abuse, including the use of a '"stupefying" substance.

title.children: Staff member at country WA school to face court over historical child sex abuse, drugging allegations

image.altText: A man smiling against a backdrop of water, wearing sunglasses in the sunny glare.

props.synopsis: The Australian embassy is understood to be involved in bringing the body of Liam Ryan back to Australia.

title.children: Perth family pay tribute to 'beautiful, gifted' man killed while on Thai holiday

image.altText: Harris in a brown suit smiles looking up at Obama in a black suit in front of a gaudy yellow curtain

props.synopsis: The former US president and his wife throw their support behind the current vice-president as the presumptive Democratic presidential candidate.

title.children: Obamas endorse Kamala Harris's US presidential bid

image.altText: An aerial image of an airboat travelling across a flood plain in Kakadu National Park.

props.synopsis: The federal government has refused an extension on the lease of the Jabiluka uranium mine, which has never been mined or developed, and will move to protect the site permanently as part of Kakadu National Park.

title.children: Albanese vows 'there will never be mining at Jabiluka' as mine lease ended

image.altText: Two men walking outside of court

props.synopsis: Two teenagers who wanted to date each other were instead forced by relatives to marry, a Perth court hears.

title.children: Trio accused of forcing teens into marriage 'for cultural reasons'

image.altText: A crowded train station

props.synopsis: Fires started in railway cabling have impacted up to 800,000 people across the French railway network on the eve of the Paris Olympics.

title.children: France's high-speed rail network hit by arson attacks hours before Paris Games begin

image.altText: A police officer opens a gate on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Australian Transport and Safety Bureau investigators are due to arrive in WA's remote north to determine what caused two helicopters to collide mid-air.

title.children: Investigators head to remote cattle station in search of fatal helicopter crash answers

image.altText: A helicopter hovers over homes inundated with light brown water in a flood

props.synopsis: Parts of northern Japan received nearly 400mm of rain, with 200,000 people on alert for more rain in coming days.

title.children: Thousands evacuated and two people killed as record rains lash northern Japan

image.altText: Jason Horne-Francis celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide looked gone for all money after Carlton kicked seven goals in the second quarter, only to put together a second half for the ages.

title.children: Carlton stunned as Port Adelaide boosts top-four hopes with remarkable comeback win

image.altText: A whale get's dragged on the beach by a yellow tractor with people surroundi9ng. Image is taken from birds eye view.

props.synopsis: Researchers and wildlife authorities say disposal of mammoth bodies is a complicated process after a humpback was carefully loaded onto a truck and buried at the Geraldton tip.

title.children: How do you remove a rotting whale? Well, it's not that simple

image.altText: an indigenous woman with a black ponytail wears a top with a green and yellow wattle design, the bush in the background

props.synopsis: Tributes flow for Linda Burney but with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's cabinet reshuffle just days away, this is who everyone is tipping to replace her.

title.children: A cabinet reshuffle is days away and this is the top pick for Minister Burney's role

image.altText: Mia Davies side profile speaking during an interview.

props.synopsis: Former WA opposition leader Mia Davies is set to confirm her bid for a spot in Canberra, 18-months after announcing she was quitting state politics.

title.children: Former WA Nationals leader Mia Davies to take tilt at new Perth federal seat of Bullwinkel

image.altText: US Senator Kamala Harris smiles widely as she walks ahead of three other people.

props.synopsis: As Joe Biden starts his long goodbye with a televised address from the Oval Office, Donald Trump and his likely rival in November's presidential election, Kamala Harris, have been trading blows as a recast race for the White House begins.

title.children: As Biden pledges to 'pass the torch', his VP is sharpening her attacks on Trump

image.altText: Donald Trump is shielded by secret service as blood spreads from an injury on his ear

props.synopsis: Much about the shooter's motives, methods and how he was allowed to get so close to former US president Donald Trump during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania on July 13 remain a mystery.

title.children: A bullet or shrapnel? Here's what we know almost two weeks after the attempted assassination of Donald Trump
